intro: Piaranthus foetidus, commonly known as the stinking nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom at night, attracting specific pollinators. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a somewhat unpleasant odor, contributing to its common name. Despite its noxious scent, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
